drinkName.name: Monte Cassino
drinkName.about: Two French liqueurs plus American rye and lemon juice equals one fine drink.

mix.how: Shake all the ingredients with ice.
Fine strain the mixture into a chilled coupe or small cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: El Bicentenario
drinkName.about: Celebrate with this spicy tangerine and tequila cocktail.

ingredients.ingredient: Agave syrup (1 part agave nectar, 1 part water)

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the habanero and tangerine.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake vigorously and strain into a Collins glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a tangerine wheel.

drinkName.name: Green Deacon
drinkName.about: Gin, grapefruit juice and absinthe make one tasty drink.

mix.how: Rinse a chilled cocktail or coupe glass with absinthe and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a grapefruit wedge.

drinkName.name: Red Hook
drinkName.about: Honor the hip Brooklyn neighborhood with this version of the Manhattan.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a maraschino cherry.

drinkName.name: Sage Passage
drinkName.about: Mango, pomegranate and sage for a nice autumn note.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with a spanked sage leaf and a cucumber wheel.

drinkName.name: Liberation Libation
drinkName.about: Maple syrup, apple cider and Vermont vodka: How much more autumnal could you get?

mix.how: Combine equal parts cinnamon and sugar on a shallow plate and use to coat the rim of a cocktail glass.
Add the vodka and maple syrup to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into the prepared glass.
Top with the cider.

drinkName.name: The Goldwyn Follies
drinkName.about: An old-timey name for a tasty fall gin-and-tea drink.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail or coupe glass.
Garnish with thin apple slices.

drinkName.name: Gold Label Frost
drinkName.about: What happens when you add Scotch to apple cider?

ingredients.ingredient: Johnnie Walker Gold Label Scotch Whisky

mix.how: Add the Johnnie Walker, apple cider and apple bitters to a Collins glass filled with ice and stir.
Garnish with a lemon peel.

drinkName.name: Lavender Honey Cream
drinkName.about: This luscious drink looks as beautiful as it tastes.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice.
Shake gently for 30 seconds.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a few lavender blossoms.

drinkName.name: Singapore Raffles Sling
drinkName.about: This classic is named for the hotel where it was invented.

mix.how: Pour the gin, Bénédictine and cherry brandy into a sling or highball glass.
Fill with ice and top with club soda.
Squeeze a lime wedge over the drink, drop it into the glass and stir.
Garnish with a cherry.

drinkName.name: The Holland House
drinkName.about: A little lemon juice and dry vermouth fire up this classic cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with large, cold, hard ice cubes.
Shake, and double-strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Eau De VeeV
drinkName.about: Start your night with this refreshing bubbly and citrus concoction.

mix.how: Squeeze the fruit wedges into a highball glass filled with ice and then drop them in.
Add the VeeV and the lime juice and stir.
Top with the tonic water and garnish with a citrus wheel.

drinkName.name: Triple Citrus 24
drinkName.about: Load up on vitamin C.

mix.how: Add both ingredients to a Collins or highball glass filled with ice.
Garnish with a lemon wheel, lime wheel and orange wheel.

drinkName.name: Strawberry Cranberry Mule
drinkName.about: Sweet and tart without a kick.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the strawberries and cranberries.
Add the vodka, lime juice and simple syrup, and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a highball glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with the ginger beer and garnish with a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Cosmo Rita
drinkName.about: This is what happens when Carrie and the gals go to Mexico.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake for 11 seconds and strain into a cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Ultimat Dill
drinkName.about: Dill and cucumber add a savory note to this vodka-lime cocktail.

drinkName.name: Sage Lady
drinkName.about: This drink’s herb flavor is perfect for an autumn cocktail party.

ingredients.ingredient: Simple syrup (one part sugar, one part water)

mix.how: Tear the sage leaves to release their oils and drop them into a shaker.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a sage leaf.

drinkName.name: Dubonnet Cocktail
drinkName.about: Like Martinis? Try this complex drink.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Baileys Cool Raspberry
drinkName.about: Chill out with this simple, rich and fruity drink.

mix.how: In a rocks glass, muddle the raspberries.
Add the Baileys and fill with crushed ice.
Garnish with 3 speared raspberries.

drinkName.name: Yamazaki Autumn Delight
drinkName.about: Celebrate the season with this whisky-and-cider cocktail.

mix.how: Add the whisky and cider to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Dust with ground cinnamon and garnish with 2 apple slices and a cinnamon stick.

drinkName.name: Albariño Mint Julep
drinkName.about: The crisp freshness of the Spanish white wine pairs perfectly with fresh mint.

ingredients.ingredient: Albariño wine (Terras Gauda Abadia de San Campio 2009)
Crème de pêche (or high-quality peach liqueur)

mix.how: Add both ingredients to a julep or large old fashioned glass.
Add lots of crushed ice and garnish lavishly with mint.

drinkName.name: Pisco Punch
drinkName.about: Get to know Peru’s national spirit in this tropical cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a white wine glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with pineapple chunks and a cherry.

drinkName.name: The Sherry-Netherland
drinkName.about: Dutch genever and Spanish sherry make this cocktail a European tour in a glass.

mix.how: Add enough raisins to cover the bottom of a shaker and muddle.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and double-strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with four speared raisins.

drinkName.name: Nomayo
drinkName.about: It’s strong, suave and sophisticated.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients, except the Champagne, to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake and strain into a chilled coupe or Martini glass.
Float the Champagne on top and garnish with a lime twist.

drinkName.name: Partida Margarita
drinkName.about: Reintroduce yourself to this simple-to-make classic.

ingredients.ingredient: Agave syrup (one part agave nectar, one part water)

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled Margarita or cocktail glass, or an Old Fashioned glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Cardamom Pear Martini
drinkName.about: Get into an autumn mood.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the pear and cardamom.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake, and double strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with a pear fan.

drinkName.name: Desert Pear Mojito
drinkName.about: A little pear syrup turns the basic Mojito into a great fall cocktail.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the lime and mint.
Add the rum and pear syrup and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a tall glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with a splash of lemon-lime soda and garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Leblon Caipirinha
drinkName.about: Every day is carnaval when you’re drinking the national cocktail of Brazil.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the lime and sugar or simple syrup.
Fill with ice and add the cachaça.
Shake vigorously and pour (unstrained) into a rocks glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Grand Mimosa
drinkName.about: Punch up this brunch favorite with a splash of Grand Marnier.

mix.how: Add the Grand Marnier and fresh orange juice to a Champagne flute and top with Champagne.
Garnish with a strawberry (optional).

drinkName.name: Watermelon Mojito
drinkName.about: Savor the dog days of summer with this fruity cooler.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the mint, lime juice, agave nectar and watermelon.
Add the rum and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: The Royal Crest
drinkName.about: Rémy Martin Cognac and white wine, crowned with a fresh-grape garnish.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the grapes and simple syrup.
Add the cognac and wine, and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a tall glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with the club soda and garnish with additional grapes.

drinkName.name: Beefeater Summer and Cranberry
drinkName.about: There’s still time to make this seasonal cocktail before the beginning of fall.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a tall glass filled with ice.
Stir and garnish with a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Chopin Red Wine
drinkName.about: Sip on summer with this berry-and-juice cocktail.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the berries.
Add the remaining ingredients and shake without ice.
Fill with ice and stir briefly.
Strain into a stemless wine glass and garnish with a raspberry, blackberry and cranberry on a skewer.

drinkName.name: Black Gold
drinkName.about: You don’t need to be an oil tycoon to enjoy this cocktail.

mix.how: Pour the vodka into a rocks glass filled with ice.
Garnish with black pepper.

drinkName.name: Basil Watermelon Cooler
drinkName.about: Cool down with this refreshing mix of vodka, watermelon and ginger.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the basil, ginger, watermelon and simple syrup.
Add the vodka and lime juice, and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Top with ginger ale and garnish with a watermelon chunk and basil leaf.

drinkName.name: Absolut Berri Açai Sour
drinkName.about: The super-food-trifecta: açai, blueberry and pomegranate.

mix.how: Shake all the ingredients with ice and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with blueberries and a mint sprig.

drinkName.name: Oranje Burst
drinkName.about: A vodka and citrus explosion.

mix.how: Pour Van Gogh Oranje Vodka and orange juice into a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake and strain into a flute.
Top with sparkling wine and garnish with an orange slice.

drinkName.name: Brazilian
drinkName.about: Toast the host of the 2016 Olympics with this acai, blueberry and lemonade combo.

mix.how: Add Van Gogh Açai-Blueberry Vodka and lemonade to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a chilled martini glass.
Garnish with a lemon wheel.

drinkName.name: Brazilian Sangria
drinkName.about: Take a trip south of the equator with this tasty Sangria.

ingredients.ingredient: Fresh seasonal fruit (recommended: strawberry, lime, orange, kiwi and passion fruit)

mix.how: In a shaker, thoroughly muddle the fruit with the absinthe, cachaça, brandy and orange liqueur.
Pour into a wine glass.
Float the red wine on top and stir briefly.

drinkName.name: Absolut 100 Pumpkin Martini
drinkName.about: Celebrate Halloween year-round.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick.

drinkName.name: The Nose to Cocktail
drinkName.about: Much better than the grindstone.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and shake vigorously without ice for 10 seconds.
Fill with ice and shake for 10 seconds more.
Strain into a highball glass.

drinkName.name: Absolut Boston Home Run
drinkName.about: Have a few thirsty buddies? Mix up a few of these for a grand slam.

mix.how: Add ingredients to a highball glass filled with ice.

drinkName.name: Holiday Glögg
drinkName.about: Just because the holidays are technically over it doesn’t mean you can’t drink some Glögg.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a saucepan over medium heat.
Simmer very lightly for at least 30 minutes (do not boil).
Remove and discard the mulling spices.
Serve in mugs, garnishing each with a few raisins and blanched almonds.

drinkName.name: Berry Tulip
drinkName.about: Two ingredients, many flavors.

mix.how: Add the vodka to a rocks glass filled with ice. Top with lemonade and garnish with blueberries.

drinkName.name: Snickertini
drinkName.about: Have one for dessert.

mix.how: Drizzle thin lines of caramel and chocolate sauce on the inside of a rocks glass and chill in the refrigerator.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and pour (unstrained) into the prepared glass.

drinkName.name: Van Gogh Dutch Appel Sangria
drinkName.about: Apple vodka gives the wine punch an autumnal feel.

mix.how: Combine the Van Gogh Wild Appel Vodka, orange liqueur, white wine and pineapple juice in a large pitcher.
Mix in the sugar until it's completely dissolved.
Add in all the fresh fruit and put the pitcher into the refrigerator for at least an hour.
Serve over ice.

drinkName.name: Starry Night
drinkName.about: This vodka cocktail is good whether or not you can see stars.

mix.how: Pour chilled Van Gogh Açai-Blueberry Vodka into a flute.
Top with sparkling rosé wine and garnish with a starfruit.

drinkName.name: Pomosa
drinkName.about: Stronger than a mere Mimosa.

mix.how: Pour the vodka into a Champagne flute. Top with the sparkling wine and garnish with a strawberry.

drinkName.name: PomPom
drinkName.about: Start your own cheer with this pomegranate cocktail.

mix.how: Fill an ice cube tray with a mix of equal parts pomegranate juice and water and freeze over night.
Place cubes in a tall glass and top with Van Gogh Pomegranate Vodka.
Garnish the drink with an orange wheel.

drinkName.name: Leche Mexicana (Mexican Milk)
drinkName.about: Milk does a body good, even when there’s tequila in it.

ingredients.ingredient: DeKuyper Crème de Cocoa White Cream

mix.how: Pour all the ingredients into a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake and strain the mixture into a small glass.

drinkName.name: Finlandia Vodka Cranberry French Martini
drinkName.about: A Finnish twist on an old Parisian classic.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist.

drinkName.name: Absolut Boston Mojito
drinkName.about: It’s delicious even outside Massachusetts.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the mint leaves, simple syrup and lime juice.
Add the vodka and fill with ice.
Shake, and pour (unstrained) into a highball glass.
Top with club soda.

drinkName.name: Bulleit Mint Julep
drinkName.about: Spicy rye whiskey gives the Southern classic a bit more edge.

mix.how: In a rocks glass, muddle the mint leaves and simple syrup.
Add the rye and fill with crushed ice.
Stir well and garnish with a sprig of mint.

drinkName.name: Adult Marshmallows
drinkName.about: Do some molecular gastronomy at home.

mix.how: Line a jelly-roll pan with parchment paper and lightly grease the paper with oil.
Cut a second piece of parchment paper the same size, oil it lightly and set aside.
Sprinkle the gelatin over half a cup of cold water and briefly stir to completely moisten it and break up any clumps.
Let the gelatin sit in the cold water until it swells and softens (10 to15 minutes).
Combine the sugar and corn syrup with the remaining half cup of water in a heavy bottomed saucepan and stir to moisten the sugar.
Cook over high heat, stirring constantly until the mixture comes to a boil.
Immediately stop stirring and skim the surface to remove any scum that has risen to the top.
Continue to cook over high heat, occasionally brushing down the side of the pan using a pastry brush and water, until the mixture registers 242 degrees on a candy thermometer.
Remove the mixture from the heat and let cool to approximately 210 degrees.
Place the gelatin in a heatproof-bowl over a pan of simmering water.
Stir constantly until the mixture is clear and liquid.
Mix the liqueur into the dissolved gelatin.
Mix the gelatin into the cooked sugar mixture and transfer to a mixing bowl.
Whip the mixture with an electric mixer on high-speed until medium peaks form (about eight to 10 minutes).
Quickly spread the mixture onto the lined pan.
Top the mixture with the prepared oiled parchment paper and use a rolling pin to smooth it into an even slab.
Place the pan in the freezer for at least eight and up to 24 hours before taking the slab out of the pan.
After chilling, gently peel off the paper from one side.
Lightly dust the marshmallow slab with some cornstarch.
Flip the slab over and gently peel off the parchment paper from the other side.
Dust with cornstarch.
Cut the marshmallows to your desired size.
You can store the marshmallows in an airtight container in the freezer for up to four months.

drinkName.name: Hornitos Holiday Smash
drinkName.about: Seasonal fruits are the key to this drink’s winter flavor.

mix.how: In a sturdy double Old Fashioned glass, muddle the cloves.
Add the pear, lemon, orange and simple syrup, and muddle again.
Fill with ice, add the tequila and stir to combine.

drinkName.name: Chopin Poinsettia Martini
drinkName.about: Just as pretty as the holiday plant, and this one sparkles too.

mix.how: Add the vodka and cranberry juice to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Top with the Champagne and garnish with raspberries.

drinkName.name: Summer Martini
drinkName.about: Beefeater’s special Summer Edition Gin packs a heavy dose of floral flavor.

mix.how: Add both ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir until well chilled and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with a blackberry and a raspberry on a toothpick.

drinkName.name: Fireside Cosmo Wine
drinkName.about: Warm up with this shiraz-and-vodka drink.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel.

drinkName.name: Midori Merry Berry Bowl
drinkName.about: The red-and-green punch screams Christmas cheer.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir and strain into a cocktail or punch glass.
Garnish with the cranberries, pear slices pierced with cloves, 2 cinnamon sticks and winter melon balls.
To make a punch version multiply the recipe by eight.

drinkName.name: Autumn Side Car Wine[tail]
drinkName.about: A chardonnay twist on a cocktail classic.

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the orange, basil and agave nectar.
Add the wine and brandy, and fill with ice.
Shake well and double-strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Add a splash of Grand Marnier and garnish with an orange twist and an orange slice.

drinkName.name: Zen Merry Manhattan
drinkName.about: Find your center with this whiskey and green tea liqueur cocktail.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass.
Add ice and stir briskly for 20 seconds.
Strain into a chilled 4 oz cocktail glass.
Garnish with a sugar covered cherry.

drinkName.name: Warming Zen
drinkName.about: Chase away the chills and find enlightenment.

ingredients.ingredient: Simple syrup (one part sugar, one part water)

mix.how: Add the liqueur, whiskey and simple syrup to a coffee mug.
Stir and then add steamed milk.
Finish with a sprinkle of matcha and cocoa powders.
Garnish with a cinnamon stick.

drinkName.name: Midori Peppermint Kiss
drinkName.about: Try this minty and fruity cocktail with a hint of melon.

ingredients.ingredient: Basil leaves, gently torn in half

mix.how: In a chilled shaker glass, add all the ingredients.
Add ice, shake for 15 seconds and strain into a Collins glass.
Garnish with a basil leaf and one raspberry.

drinkName.name: Holiday Sparkler Wine
drinkName.about: Sparks will fly with this sparkling rose and cranberry juice cocktail.

mix.how: Soak a sugar cube in orange bitters.
Place it in a flute.
Add elderflower liqueur and cranberry juice and gently top off the drink with Yellow Tail Rose.
Garnish with a rock candy stir stick.

drinkName.name: Holiday Cheer
drinkName.about: Its fizzy cranberry flavor and savory rosemary garnish will make you happy.

mix.how: Muddle the cranberries in a shaker.
Fill with ice, add the vodka and shake vigorously. Pour into a tall glass and top with the tonic water and sparkling cider.
Garnish with a rosemary sprig.

drinkName.name: Couture-tini
drinkName.about: Two wines and some strawberries; what’s not to like?

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the Korbel to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a chilled Martini glass.
Top with Korbel and garnish with a strawberry.

drinkName.name: Fashionista
drinkName.about: She knows how to spice up a Little Black Dress.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Gently roll the shaker to mix and pour into a tall glass.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

drinkName.name: Chopin Holiday Punch
drinkName.about: Satisfy a houseful of party guests with this festive libation.

mix.how: In a large pitcher, combine all the ingredients except the club soda and bitters.
Cover with plastic wrap and chill for 24 hours.
To serve, pour the mixture into rocks or Collins glasses filled with fresh ice.
Top with club soda and a dash of bitters.

drinkName.name: Moon Mountain Raspberry Sling
drinkName.about: Overload on raspberry flavor with this gingery drink

ingredients.ingredient: Moon Mountain Wild Raspberry Flavored Vodka

mix.how: In a shaker, muddle the raspberries.
Add the remaining ingredients and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with fresh raspberries and a lime twist.

drinkName.name: Coastal Citrus & Basil
drinkName.about: A couple basil leaves add depth and complexity to a simple, lemony cocktail.

ingredients.ingredient: Moon Mountain Coastal Citrus Flavored Vodka

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lemon peel and/or basil sprig.

drinkName.name: Moon Mountain Greyhound
drinkName.about: This is a fruitier take on the classic grapefruit concoction.

ingredients.ingredient: Moon Mountain Wild Raspberry Flavored Vodka

mix.how: If desired, coat the rim of a rocks glass with salt.
Fill with ice and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a grapefruit peel and/or a fresh rosemary sprig.

drinkName.name: Citrus Flower Sour
drinkName.about: It’s rhyme time with this sweet-and-tart vodka drink.

ingredients.ingredient: Moon Mountain Coastal Citrus Flavored Vodka

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake well and strain into a rocks glass filled with fresh ice.
Garnish with an orange twist.

drinkName.name: The Irish Car Bomb
drinkName.about: Making an Irish Car Bomb is easy. Grab a pint and detonate this guilty pleasure.

ingredients.ingredient:
Irish whiskey
Try it with Jameson

mix.how: Add the Baileys and whiskey to a shot glass.
Drop the shot into a half-pint of the beer.

drinkName.name: Flaming Dr. Pepper Shot
drinkName.about: Please, have a fire extinguisher handy.

mix.how: Fill a pint glass halfway with beer.
Add the amaretto to a shot glass and top with the rum.
Set the rum on fire and very carefully drop the shot glass into the beer.This is one drink best to order in a bar and not make at home.

drinkName.name: “Plumdog” Millionaire
drinkName.about: You don’t have to be rich to enjoy this plum cocktail.

mix.how: Coat the rim of a Martini glass with lavender sugar and set aside.
Add the remaining ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice.
Stir, and strain into the prepared glass.
Garnish with a black plum half-wheel.

drinkName.name: New Year’s Sparkler
drinkName.about: Ring it in with fruit and bubbly.

mix.how: Add the vodka and cranberry juice to a chilled Champagne flute.
Top with Champagne and garnish with 5-6 raspberries on a long skewer.

drinkName.name: Finlandia Vodka Wild Berritini
drinkName.about: Berries, berries and berriesin the vodka, liqueur and garnishmake this an ideal summer drink.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients except the club soda to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a cocktail class.
Top with the club soda and garnish with fresh berries.

drinkName.name: VeeV Holiday Highball
drinkName.about: After a long day shopping for the holidays, reward yourself with this Veev holiday cocktail.

mix.how: Muddle the mint and simple syrup in the bottom of a shaker.
Add VeeV Açaí Spirit, Green Chartreuse and ice.
Shake well.
Pour into a highball glass and top with sparkling cider.
Garnish with an apple chip.

drinkName.name: Tropical Sunset
drinkName.about: Take a sip, close your eyes and soak up the sun.

mix.how: Add the Van Gogh Coconut Vodka, Van Gogh Pineapple Vodka and pineapple juice to a cocktail shaker and fill with ice. Shake and pour into a Martini glass.
Add splash of grenadine and garnish with a pineapple wedge.

drinkName.name: Hydrate
drinkName.about: You heard the cocktail: Drink up.

mix.how: Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice.
Shake, and strain into a Martini glass.
Garnish with a cucumber slice and a mint sprig.
